alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clay, central Ray and northern Jackson Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Missouri City, or near Excelsior Springs, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Liberty, Gladstone, Excelsior Springs, Richmond, North Kansas City, Sugar Creek, Claycomo, Courtney, Pleasant Valley, Orrick, Glenaire, Avondale, Oakview, Henrietta, Crystal Lakes, Sibley, Missouri City and River Bend. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 8 and 21. Interstate 29 near mile marker 0. Interstate 435 between mile markers 47 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
